Name: Pectoral of Sennedjem
Description: Many of the workers of Deir el-Medina made their jewelry like that which was designed for royalty. However, they used cheaper materials. This pectoral of Sennedjem is made of painted wood and has a cornice on the top. The front of the pectoral is carved in sunken relief with a solar bark, or boat. It has an upright scarab placed between the goddesses Maat and Nephthys. The underside has a depiction of the bottom of the scarab, which is placed between two Djed signs. The scarab is inscribed with eight lines of Spell 30b of the Book of the Dead.
